title: How to Make Langue de Chat Biscuits

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 220ºC/425ºF.
steps.description: Prepare the baking tray (sheet) by greasing or covering with parchment paper.

steps.headline: Place the sugar, flour and vanilla sugar into the mixing bowl.
Whisk the 3 egg whites together until stiff.
steps.description: Fold them into the dry mixture gently.

steps.headline: Pipe the batter onto the baking tray.
steps.description: Pipe lines about 5cm/2 inches in length. Leave plenty of space between each biscuit line (about 2.5cm/1 inch) to allow spreading space.

steps.headline: Place the tray in the oven.
steps.description: Bake the biscuits for about 8 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove when the biscuits start turning golden brown.
steps.description: Allow to cool briefly on the tray, then move to a wire cooling rack to cool completely.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: These biscuits go well with desserts and are nice as an afternoon tea treat. Children love them.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 220ºC/425ºF.
steps.description: Prepare the baking tray (sheet) by greasing or covering with parchment paper.

steps.headline: Beat the butter with a wooden spatula until it becomes smooth.
Put the smooth butter pieces and sugars into the mixing bowl.
steps.description: Work together for about 5 minutes using the wooden spatula.

steps.headline: Blend in the 2 eggs.
steps.description: Add them in one at a time.

steps.headline: Add the flour gradually.
steps.description: Mix each portion of flour in with the whisk.

steps.headline: Pipe the batter onto the baking tray.
steps.description: Pipe lines about 5cm/2 inches in length. Leave plenty of space between each biscuit line (about 2.5cm/1 inch) to allow spreading space.

steps.headline: Place the tray in the oven.
steps.description: Bake the biscuits for about 8 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove when the biscuits start turning golden brown.
steps.description: Allow to cool briefly on the tray, then move to a wire cooling rack to cool completely.

steps.headline: Serve.
steps.description: These biscuits are perfect for accompanying a soft dessert or for enjoying with a cup of tea.

text: Plain\/All-Purpose Flour Version Preheat the oven to 220ºC/425ºF. Prepare the baking tray (sheet) by greasing or covering with parchment paper. Place the sugar, flour and vanilla sugar into the mixing bowl. Stir to combine. Whisk the 3 egg whites together until stiff. Fold them into the dry mixture gently. Pipe the batter onto the baking tray. Pipe lines about 5cm/2 inches in length. Leave plenty of space between each biscuit line (about 2.5cm/1 inch) to allow spreading space. Place the tray in the oven. Bake the biscuits for about 8 minutes. Remove when the biscuits start turning golden brown. Allow to cool briefly on the tray, then move to a wire cooling rack to cool completely. Serve. These biscuits go well with desserts and are nice as an afternoon tea treat. Children love them. Self-Raising\/Self-Rising Flour Version Preheat the oven to 220ºC/425ºF. Prepare the baking tray (sheet) by greasing or covering with parchment paper. Beat the butter with a wooden spatula until it becomes smooth.  Put the smooth butter pieces and sugars into the mixing bowl. Work together for about 5 minutes using the wooden spatula. Blend in the 2 eggs. Add them in one at a time. Add the flour gradually. Mix each portion of flour in with the whisk. Pipe the batter onto the baking tray. Pipe lines about 5cm/2 inches in length. Leave plenty of space between each biscuit line (about 2.5cm/1 inch) to allow spreading space. Place the tray in the oven. Bake the biscuits for about 8 minutes. Remove when the biscuits start turning golden brown. Allow to cool briefly on the tray, then move to a wire cooling rack to cool completely. Serve. These biscuits are perfect for accompanying a soft dessert or for enjoying with a cup of tea.
